title: Sacred Mysteries: The woman behind a portrait by Velázquez
text:
At 2pm each day, the chattering throngs of schoolchildren herded towards Velázquez’s Las Meninas in the Prado melt away, for it is Spanish lunchtime. This is a good moment for independent visitors to take a quiet look at his pictures.

One was only discovered in 1926. It shows a nun in a brown habit holding a crucifix tightly, as if, it has been more than once observed, it were a weapon. She has shrewd, challenging eyes in her lined face. Held at her side by a hand showing signs of age is a volume that may be a prayer book, or perhaps the rule of her order.

This formidable woman is Jerónima de la Fuente, and she was painted in 1620 in Seville, from where she was to set sail for the Philippines....
description: At 2pm each day, the chattering throngs of schoolchildren herded towards Velázquez’s Las Meninas in the Prado melt away, for it is Spanish lunchtime.
